abandon\rto turn a face-up ongoing schem.term: AbandonTo turn a face-up ongoing scheme card face down and put it on the bottom of its owner’s scheme deck. See rule 701.33, “Abandon.”

ability\r1. text on an object that expla.term: Ability1. Text on an object that explains what that object does or can do.2. An activated or triggered ability on the stack. This kind of ability is an object.See rule 113, “Abilities,” and section 6, “Spells, Abilities, and Effects.”

ability word\ran italicized word with no.term: Ability WordAn italicized word with no rules meaning that ties together abilities on different cards that have similar functionality. See rule 207.2c.

absorb\ra keyword ability that prevents.term: AbsorbA keyword ability that prevents damage. See rule 702.64, “Absorb.”

activate\rto put an activated ability on.term: ActivateTo put an activated ability onto the stack and pay its costs, so that it will eventually resolve and have its effect. See rule 602, “Activating Activated Abilities.”

activated ability\ra kind of ability. ac.term: Activated AbilityA kind of ability. Activated abilities are written as “[Cost]: [Effect.] [Activation instructions (if any).]” See rule 113, “Abilities,” and rule 602, “Activating Activated Abilities.”

activation cost\reverything that appears.term: Activation CostEverything that appears before the colon in an activated ability’s text. It must be paid to activate the ability. See rule 118, “Costs,” and rule 602, “Activating Activated Abilities.”

active player\rthe player whose turn it.term: Active PlayerThe player whose turn it is. See rule 102.1.

active player, nonactive player order\ra.term: Active Player, Nonactive Player OrderA system that determines the order by which players make choices if multiple players are instructed to make choices at the same time. See rule 101.4. This rule is modified for games using the shared team turns option; see rule 805.6.

active team\rthe team whose turn it is i.term: Active TeamThe team whose turn it is in a game using the shared team turns option. See rule 805.4a.

adapt\ra keyword action that puts +1/+1.term: AdaptA keyword action that puts +1/+1 counters on a creature that doesn’t have any yet. See rule 701.46, “Adapt.”

additional cost\ra cost a spell may have.term: Additional CostA cost a spell may have that its controller may pay (or, in some cases, must pay) in addition to its mana cost to cast that spell. See rule 118, “Costs,” and rule 601, “Casting Spells.”

adventurer card\rcards with a two-part c.term: Adventurer CardCards with a two-part card frame (one part of which is inset on the left) on a single card where the alternative characteristics include the Adventure spell type. See rule 715, “Adventurer Cards.”

affinity\ra keyword ability that reduces.term: AffinityA keyword ability that reduces how much mana you need to spend to cast a spell. See rule 702.41, “Affinity.”

afflict\ra keyword ability that makes th.term: AfflictA keyword ability that makes the defending player lose life for blocking. See rule 702.130, “Afflict.”

afterlife\ra keyword ability that leaves.term: AfterlifeA keyword ability that leaves behind Spirit creature tokens when certain creatures die. See rule 702.135, “Afterlife.”

aftermath\ra keyword ability that lets a.term: AftermathA keyword ability that lets a player cast one half of a split card only from their graveyard. See rule 702.127, “Aftermath.”

alternating teams variant\ra multiplayer.term: Alternating Teams VariantA multiplayer variant played among two or more teams of equal size. See rule 811, “Alternating Teams Variant.”

alternative cost\ra cost a spell may hav.term: Alternative CostA cost a spell may have that its controller can pay rather than paying its mana cost. See rule 118, “Costs,” and rule 601, “Casting Spells.”

alternate name\ra different name used on.term: Alternate NameA different name used on promotional or alternate-art versions of some cards. This name has no rules meaning. See rule 201.6.

amass\ra keyword action that gives you a.term: AmassA keyword action that gives you a Zombie Army creature token or grows an Army you already have. See rule 701.47, “Amass.”

amplify\ra keyword ability than can have.term: AmplifyA keyword ability than can have a creature enter the battlefield with +1/+1 counters on it. See rule 702.38, “Amplify.”

anchor word\ra word that precedes one of.term: Anchor WordA word that precedes one of two abilities a permanent may enter the battlefield with. See rule 614.12b.

annihilator\ra keyword ability that can.term: AnnihilatorA keyword ability that can make a creature particularly brutal when it attacks. See rule 702.86, “Annihilator.”

ante\r1. a zone used only when playing “.term: Ante1. A zone used only when playing “for keeps.”2. To put a card into the ante zone.See rule 407, “Ante.”

any target\ra spell or ability may requi.term: Any TargetA spell or ability may require “any target.” “Any target” is the same as “target creature, player, or planeswalker.” See rule 115.4.

apnap order\rsee active player, nonactiv.term: APNAP OrderSee Active Player, Nonactive Player Order.

archenemy\r1. a casual variant in which.term: Archenemy1. A casual variant in which a team of players faces off against a single opponent strengthened with powerful scheme cards. See rule 904, “Archenemy.”2. A player in an Archenemy game who is playing with a scheme deck.

archenemy commander\ra commander game th.term: Archenemy CommanderA Commander game that follows a modified version of the Archenemy rules. See rule 903, “Commander,” and rule 904, “Archenemy.”

artifact\ra card type. an artifact is a.term: ArtifactA card type. An artifact is a permanent. See rule 301, “Artifacts.”

artifact creature\ra combination of arti.term: Artifact CreatureA combination of artifact and creature that’s subject to the rules for both. See rule 301, “Artifacts,” and rule 302, “Creatures.”

artifact land\ra combination of artifact.term: Artifact LandA combination of artifact and land that’s subject to the rules for both. Artifact lands can only be played as lands, not cast as spells. See rule 301, “Artifacts,” and rule 305, “Lands.”

artifact type\ra subtype that’s correlat.term: Artifact TypeA subtype that’s correlated to the artifact card type. See rule 301, “Artifacts.” See rule 205.3g for the list of artifact types.

as though\rtext used to indicate that th.term: As ThoughText used to indicate that the game, for some specific purpose, treats a condition as true even though it’s not. See rule 609.4.

ascend\ra keyword causing a player to ge.term: AscendA keyword causing a player to get the designation of the city’s blessing once they control ten permanents. See rule 702.131, “Ascend.”

assemble\rassemble is a keyword action i.term: AssembleAssemble is a keyword action in the Unstable set that puts Contraptions onto the battlefield. Cards and mechanics from the Unstable set aren’t included in these rules.

assign combat damage\rto determine how a.term: Assign Combat DamageTo determine how an attacking or blocking creature will deal its combat damage. See rule 510, “Combat Damage Step.”

assist\ra keyword ability that lets anot.term: AssistA keyword ability that lets another player help you pay for a spell. See rule 702.132, “Assist.”

at end of turn (obsolete)\ra trigger con.term: At End of Turn (Obsolete)A trigger condition printed on abilities that triggered at the beginning of the end step (which is not the last thing to happen in the turn). Cards that were printed with that text have received errata in the Oracle card reference to say “at the beginning of the end step” or “at the beginning of the next end step.” See rule 513, “End Step.”

attach\rto take an aura, equipment, or f.term: AttachTo take an Aura, Equipment, or Fortification from where it currently is and put it onto a specified object or player. See rule 701.3, “Attach.”

attack\rto send a creature into combat o.term: AttackTo send a creature into combat offensively. A creature can attack a player or a planeswalker. See rule 508, “Declare Attackers Step.”

attack alone\ra creature “attacks alone”.term: Attack AloneA creature “attacks alone” if it’s the only creature declared as an attacker during the declare attackers step. A creature “is attacking alone” if it’s attacking but no other creatures are. See rule 506.5.

attack left option\ran option that may b.term: Attack Left OptionAn option that may be used in certain multiplayer variants. See rule 803, “Attack Left and Attack Right Options.”

attack multiple players option\ran optio.term: Attack Multiple Players OptionAn option that may be used in certain multiplayer variants. See rule 802, “Attack Multiple Players Option.”

attack right option\ran option that may.term: Attack Right OptionAn option that may be used in certain multiplayer variants. See rule 803, “Attack Left and Attack Right Options.”

attacking creature\ra creature that has.term: Attacking CreatureA creature that has either been declared as part of a legal attack during the combat phase (once all costs to attack, if any, have been paid), or a creature that has been put onto the battlefield attacking. It remains an attacking creature until it’s removed from combat or the combat phase ends, whichever comes first. See rule 508, “Declare Attackers Step.”

attacking team\rthe team who can attack.term: Attacking TeamThe team who can attack during the combat phase of a multiplayer game using the shared team turns option. See rule 805, “Shared Team Turns Option.”

attacks and isn’t blocked\ran ability th.term: Attacks and Isn’t BlockedAn ability that triggers when a creature “attacks and isn’t blocked” triggers when the creature becomes an unblocked attacking creature. See rule 509.1h.

attraction\ran artifact type seen only o.term: AttractionAn artifact type seen only on nontraditional Magic cards in the Unfinity expansion. See rule 717, “Attraction Cards,” rule 701.51, “Open an Attraction,” and rule 701.52, “Roll to Visit Your Attractions.”

attraction deck\ran optional deck of at.term: Attraction DeckAn optional deck of at least three (in limited play) or ten (in constructed play) Attraction cards that can be used to support play with some cards from the Unfinity expansion. See rule 717.2.

aura\ran enchantment subtype. aura spell.term: AuraAn enchantment subtype. Aura spells target objects or players, and Aura permanents are attached to objects or players. See rule 303, “Enchantments,” and rule 702.5, “Enchant.”

aura swap\ra keyword ability that lets y.term: Aura SwapA keyword ability that lets you exchange an Aura on the battlefield with one in your hand. See rule 702.65, “Aura Swap.”

awaken\ra keyword ability that lets you.term: AwakenA keyword ability that lets you turn a land you control into a creature. See rule 702.113, “Awaken.”

background\ran enchantment type that, in.term: BackgroundAn enchantment type that, in combination with the “choose a Background” ability, may allow a legendary enchantment card to be your commander. See rule 702.124, “Partner,” and rule 903, “Commander.”

backup\ra keyword ability that lets a cr.term: BackupA keyword ability that lets a creature give +1/+1 counters to itself or another when it enters the battlefield. If a different creature is chosen, that creature also temporarily gains one or more abilities. See rule 702.165, “Backup.”

banding, “bands with other”\rbanding is.term: Banding, “Bands with Other”Banding is a keyword ability that modifies the rules for declaring attackers and assigning combat damage. “Bands with other” is a specialized version of the ability. See rule 702.22, “Banding.”

bargain\rbargain is a keyword ability th.term: BargainBargain is a keyword ability that represents an optional additional cost of sacrificing an artifact, enchantment, or token. A spell has been bargained if its controller declared the intention to pay that cost. See rule 702.166, “Bargain.”

base power, base toughness\reffects that.term: Base Power, Base ToughnessEffects that change the base power and/or base toughness of a creature set one or both of those values to a specific number. See rule 613, “Interaction of Continuous Effects.”

basic\ra supertype that’s normally relev.term: BasicA supertype that’s normally relevant on lands. Any land with this supertype is a basic land. See rule 205.4, “Supertypes.”

basic land type\rthere are five “basic l.term: Basic Land TypeThere are five “basic land types”: Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest. Each one has a mana ability associated with it. See rule 305, “Lands.”

battle\ra card type. a battle is a perma.term: BattleA card type. A battle is a permanent. See rule 310, “Battles.”

battle cry\ra keyword ability that makes.term: Battle CryA keyword ability that makes other attacking creatures better in combat. See rule 702.91, “Battle Cry.”

battlefield\ra zone. the battlefield is.term: BattlefieldA zone. The battlefield is the zone in which permanents exist. It used to be known as the “in-play” zone. See rule 403, “Battlefield.”

becomes\ra word used in some trigger eve.term: BecomesA word used in some trigger events to indicate a change in status or characteristics. See rule 603.2f.

beginning of combat step\rpart of the tu.term: Beginning of Combat StepPart of the turn. This step is the first step of the combat phase. See rule 507, “Beginning of Combat Step.”

beginning phase\rpart of the turn. this.term: Beginning PhasePart of the turn. This phase is the first phase of the turn. See rule 501, “Beginning Phase.”

behold\ra keyword action that allows a p.term: BeholdA keyword action that allows a player to choose a permanent they control of a particular quality or reveal a card of that quality from their hand, usually to pay a cost or get an additional effect. See rule 701.4, “Behold.”

bestow\ra keyword ability that lets a cr.term: BestowA keyword ability that lets a creature card be cast as an Aura. See rule 702.103, “Bestow.”

blitz\ra keyword ability found on creatu.term: BlitzA keyword ability found on creature cards that allows them to be cast for an alternative cost. See rule 702.152, “Blitz.”

block\rto send a creature into combat de.term: BlockTo send a creature into combat defensively. A creature can block an attacking creature. See rule 509, “Declare Blockers Step.”

block alone\ra creature “blocks alone” i.term: Block AloneA creature “blocks alone” if it’s the only creature declared as a blocker during the declare blockers step. A creature “is blocking alone” if it’s blocking but no other creatures are. See rule 506.5.

blocked creature\ran attacking creature.term: Blocked CreatureAn attacking creature that another creature blocks or that an effect causes to become blocked. It remains a blocked creature until it’s removed from combat, an effect says that it becomes unblocked, or the combat phase ends, whichever comes first. See rule 509, “Declare Blockers Step.”

blocking creature\ra creature that has e.term: Blocking CreatureA creature that has either been declared as part of a legal block during the combat phase (once all costs to block, if any, have been paid), or a creature that has been put onto the battlefield blocking. It remains a blocking creature until it’s removed from combat or the combat phase ends, whichever comes first. See rule 509, “Declare Blockers Step.”

blood token\ra blood token is a colorles.term: Blood TokenA Blood token is a colorless artifact token with “{1}, {T}, Discard a card, Sacrifice this token: Draw a card.” For more information about predefined tokens, see rule 111.10.

bloodthirst\ra keyword ability that can.term: BloodthirstA keyword ability that can have a creature enter the battlefield with +1/+1 counters on it. See rule 702.54, “Bloodthirst.”

boast\ra special kind of activated abili.term: BoastA special kind of activated ability that can be activated only once each turn if the creature with the boast ability attacked that turn. See rule 702.142, “Boast.”

bolster\ra keyword action that puts +1/+.term: BolsterA keyword action that puts +1/+1 counters on the weakest creature a player controls. See rule 701.39, “Bolster.”

booster pack\ra group of unopened magic.term: Booster PackA group of unopened Magic cards from a particular expansion. Booster packs are used in Limited formats. See rule 100.2b.

brawl\ran option for the commander casua.term: BrawlAn option for the Commander casual variant. See rule 903.12, “Brawl Option.”

bury (obsolete)\ra term that meant “put.term: Bury (Obsolete)A term that meant “put [a permanent] into its owner’s graveyard.” In general, cards that were printed with the term “bury” have received errata in the Oracle card reference to read, “Destroy [a permanent]. It can’t be regenerated,” or “Sacrifice [a permanent].”

bushido\ra keyword ability that can make.term: BushidoA keyword ability that can make a creature better in combat. See rule 702.45, “Bushido.”

buyback\ra keyword ability of instants a.term: BuybackA keyword ability of instants and sorceries that can let the spell return to its owner’s hand as it resolves. See rule 702.27, “Buyback.”

card\rthe standard component of the game.term: CardThe standard component of the game. Magic cards may be traditional or nontraditional. Tokens aren’t considered cards. In the text of spells or abilities, the term “card” is used only to refer to a card that’s not on the battlefield or on the stack, such as a creature card in a player’s hand. See rule 108, “Cards.”

card pool\rin a limited format, the card.term: Card PoolIn a Limited format, the cards a player may use, in addition to basic land cards, to build their deck.

card type\ra characteristic. except for.term: Card TypeA characteristic. Except for abilities on the stack, each object has a card type, even if that object isn’t a card. Each card type has its own rules. See rule 205, “Type Line,” and section 3, “Card Types.”

cascade\ra keyword ability that may let.term: CascadeA keyword ability that may let a player cast a random extra spell for no cost. See rule 702.85, “Cascade.”

case\ran enchantment subtype. cases have.term: CaseAn enchantment subtype. Cases have a “to solve” ability that set a condition its controller must meet in order for the “solved” ability to take effect. See rule 719, “Case Cards.”

cast\rto take a card from where it is (u.term: CastTo take a card from where it is (usually the hand), put it on the stack, and pay its costs, so that it will eventually resolve and have its effect. See rule 601, “Casting Spells.”

caster (obsolete)\ran obsolete term that.term: Caster (Obsolete)An obsolete term that referred to the player who cast a spell. In general, cards that were printed with the term “caster” have received errata in the Oracle card reference to say “controller.”

casting cost (obsolete)\ran obsolete ter.term: Casting Cost (Obsolete)An obsolete term for mana cost. Cards printed with this text have received errata in the Oracle card reference.

casualty\ra keyword ability that allows.term: CasualtyA keyword ability that allows you to sacrifice a creature to create a copy of a spell. See 702.153, “Casualty.”

champion, championed\r“champion” is a ke.term: Champion, Championed“Champion” is a keyword ability that lets one creature temporarily replace another. A permanent is “championed” by another permanent if the latter exiles the former as the direct result of a champion ability. See rule 702.72, “Champion.”

change a target\rto choose a new, legal.term: Change a TargetTo choose a new, legal target for a spell or ability. See rule 115.7.

changeling\ra characteristic-defining ab.term: ChangelingA characteristic-defining ability that grants the object it’s on every creature type. See rule 702.73, “Changeling.”

chaos ability\ran ability of a plane car.term: Chaos AbilityAn ability of a plane card that triggers “Whenever chaos ensues” in the Planechase casual variant. See rule 311.7.

chaos symbol\rthe chaos symbol appears o.term: Chaos SymbolThe chaos symbol appears on the planar die and near some triggered abilities of plane cards in the Planechase casual variant. See rule 107.12.

characteristics\rinformation that define.term: CharacteristicsInformation that defines an object. See rule 109.3.

characteristic-defining ability\ra kind.term: Characteristic-Defining AbilityA kind of static ability that conveys information about an object’s characteristics that would normally be found elsewhere on that object (such as in its mana cost, type line, or power/toughness box). See rule 604.3.

choose a background\ra variant of the pa.term: Choose a BackgroundA variant of the partner ability that lets two legendary permanent cards be your commander in the Commander variant rather than one if one of them has the “choose a Background” ability and the other is a Background enchantment card. See rule 702.124, “Partner,” and rule 903, “Commander.”

cipher\ra keyword ability that allows yo.term: CipherA keyword ability that allows you to encode a card on a creature and cast that card whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player. See rule 702.99, “Cipher.”

city’s blessing\ra designation a player.term: City’s BlessingA designation a player can have. The ascend keyword causes a player to get this designation once they control ten permanents. See rule 702.131, “Ascend.”

clash\rto have a mini-contest involving.term: ClashTo have a mini-contest involving the top cards of players’ libraries. See rule 701.30, “Clash.”

class\ran enchantment subtype. classes h.term: ClassAn enchantment subtype. Classes have a number of class level abilities that increase their level and grant them new abilities. See rule 716, “Class Cards.”

cleanup step\rpart of the turn. this ste.term: Cleanup StepPart of the turn. This step is the second and final step of the ending phase. See rule 514, “Cleanup Step.”

cleave\ra keyword ability that allows yo.term: CleaveA keyword ability that allows you to pay an alternative cost to remove some of a spell’s text. See rule 702.148, “Cleave.”

cloak\ra keyword action that puts a card.term: CloakA keyword action that puts a card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature with ward {2}. See rule 701.58, “Cloak,” and rule 708, “Face-Down Spells and Permanents.”

clue token\ra clue token is a colorless.term: Clue TokenA Clue token is a colorless artifact token with “{2}, Sacrifice this token: Draw a card.” For more information about predefined tokens, see rule 111.10.

collect evidence\ra keyword action. to “.term: Collect EvidenceA keyword action. To “collect evidence N” means to exile any number of cards from your graveyard with total mana value N or greater. See rule 701.59, “Collect Evidence.”

collector number\ra number printed on mo.term: Collector NumberA number printed on most cards that has no effect on game play. See rule 213, “Information Below the Text Box.”

color\r1. a characteristic of an object..term: Color1. A characteristic of an object. See rule 105, “Colors,” and rule 202, “Mana Cost and Color.”2. An attribute mana may have. See rule 106, “Mana.”

colorless\r1. an object with no color is.term: Colorless1. An object with no color is colorless. Colorless is not a color. See rule 105, “Colors,” and rule 202, “Mana Cost and Color.”2. A type of mana. See rule 106, “Mana,” and rule 107.4c.

color identity\ra set of colors that det.term: Color IdentityA set of colors that determines what cards may be included in a deck for the Commander casual variant. See rule 903.4.

color indicator\ra characteristic of an.term: Color IndicatorA characteristic of an object. See rule 105, “Colors,” and rule 204, “Color Indicator.”

combat damage\rdamage dealt during the c.term: Combat DamageDamage dealt during the combat damage step by attacking creatures and blocking creatures as a consequence of combat. See rule 510, “Combat Damage Step.”

combat damage step\rpart of the turn. th.term: Combat Damage StepPart of the turn. This step is the fourth step of the combat phase. See rule 510, “Combat Damage Step.”

combat phase\rpart of the turn. this pha.term: Combat PhasePart of the turn. This phase is the third phase of the turn. See rule 506, “Combat Phase.”

command\ra zone for certain specialized.term: CommandA zone for certain specialized objects that have an overarching effect on the game, yet are not permanents and cannot be destroyed. See rule 408, “Command.”

commander\r1. a casual variant in which.term: Commander1. A casual variant in which each deck is led by a legendary card (usually a creature). See rule 903, “Commander.”2. A designation given to one legendary card in each player’s deck in the Commander casual variant.

commander draft\ra casual variant in whi.term: Commander DraftA casual variant in which players participate in a booster draft and then play multiplayer games. See rule 903.13, “Commander Draft.”

commander ninjutsu\ra variant of the nin.term: Commander NinjutsuA variant of the ninjutsu ability. See rule 702.49, “Ninjutsu.”

commander tax\rinformal term for the add.term: Commander TaxInformal term for the additional cost to cast a commander based on the number of times a player has cast it previously this game. See rule 903.8.

companion\ra keyword ability that allows.term: CompanionA keyword ability that allows a player to choose one creature card from outside the game as a companion if the restriction of that card’s companion ability is met. Once a player has chosen a companion, that player may pay {3} to put it into their hand once during the game. See rule 702.139, “Companion.”

compleated\ra keyword ability that cause.term: CompleatedA keyword ability that causes a planeswalker to enter the battlefield with fewer loyalty counters if a player chose to pay life for Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost. See rule 702.150, “Compleated.”

complete a dungeon\rto remove a dungeon.term: Complete a DungeonTo remove a dungeon card from the game after reaching that dungeon card’s bottommost room. See rule 309, “Dungeons.”

concede\rto quit the game. conceding a g.term: ConcedeTo quit the game. Conceding a game immediately causes that player to leave that game and lose that game. See rule 104, “Ending the Game.”

connive\ra keyword action that causes a.term: ConniveA keyword action that causes a player to draw a card, discard a card, and then to put a +1/+1 counter on a creature if a nonland card was discarded this way. See rule 701.50, “Connive.”

conspiracy\ra card type used in limited.term: ConspiracyA card type used in Limited formats such as Conspiracy Draft. A conspiracy card is not a permanent. See rule 315, “Conspiracies.”

conspiracy draft\ra casual variant in wh.term: Conspiracy DraftA casual variant in which players participate in a booster draft and then play multiplayer games. See rule 905, “Conspiracy Draft.”

conspire\ra keyword ability that creates.term: ConspireA keyword ability that creates a copy of a spell. See rule 702.78, “Conspire.”

constructed\ra way of playing in which e.term: ConstructedA way of playing in which each player creates their own deck ahead of time. See rule 100.2a.

continuous effect\ran effect that modifi.term: Continuous EffectAn effect that modifies characteristics of objects, modifies control of objects, or affects players or the rules of the game, for a fixed or indefinite period. See rule 611, “Continuous Effects.”

continuous artifact (obsolete)\ran obsol.term: Continuous Artifact (Obsolete)An obsolete term that appeared on the type line of artifacts without activated abilities. Cards printed with this text have received errata in the Oracle card reference to simply say “Artifact.”

control, controller\r“control” is the sy.term: Control, Controller“Control” is the system that determines who gets to use an object in the game. An object’s “controller” is the player who currently controls it. See rule 108.4.

control another player\rto make all choi.term: Control Another PlayerTo make all choices and decisions that player is allowed to make, or is told to make, by rules or by any objects. See rule 722, “Controlling Another Player.”

convert\rto turn a double-faced card so.term: ConvertTo turn a double-faced card so its other face is up. See rule 701.28, “Convert.”

converted mana cost (obsolete)\ran obsol.term: Converted Mana Cost (Obsolete)An obsolete term for mana value. Cards printed with this term have received errata in the Oracle card reference.

convoke\ra keyword ability that lets you.term: ConvokeA keyword ability that lets you tap creatures rather than pay mana to cast a spell. See rule 702.51, “Convoke.”

copiable values\rvalues of an object’s c.term: Copiable ValuesValues of an object’s characteristics that are checked by copy effects. See rules 613.2, 707.2, and 707.3.

copy\r1. to create a new object whose co.term: Copy1. To create a new object whose copiable values have been set to those of another object.2. An object whose copiable values have been set to those of another object.See rule 707, “Copying Objects.”

cost\ran action or payment necessary to.term: CostAn action or payment necessary to take another action or to stop another action from taking place. See rule 118, “Costs.”

counter\r1. to cancel a spell or ability.term: Counter1. To cancel a spell or ability so it doesn’t resolve and none of its effects occur. See rule 701.6, “Counter.”2. A marker placed on an object or player that modifies its characteristics or interacts with a rule or ability. See rule 122, “Counters.”

counts as (obsolete)\rsome older cards w.term: Counts As (Obsolete)Some older cards were printed with text stating that the card “counts as” something. Cards printed with this text have received errata in the Oracle card reference to state that the card actually is that thing.

craft\rcraft is an activated ability tha.term: CraftCraft is an activated ability that allows a player to exile cards from their graveyard and/or permanents they control to exile the permanent with the craft ability and return it onto the battlefield transformed. See rule 702.167, “Craft.”

create\rto create a token is to put a to.term: CreateTo create a token is to put a token onto the battlefield. See rule 701.7, “Create.”

creature\ra card type. a creature is a p.term: CreatureA card type. A creature is a permanent. See rule 302, “Creatures.”

creature type\ra subtype that’s correlat.term: Creature TypeA subtype that’s correlated to the creature card type and the kindred card type. See rule 302, “Creatures,” and rule 308, “Kindreds.” See rule 205.3m for the list of creature types.

crew\ra keyword ability that lets you ta.term: CrewA keyword ability that lets you tap creatures to turn a Vehicle into an artifact creature. See rule 301, “Artifacts,” and rule 702.122, “Crew.”

crime\rtargeting an opponent, anything t.term: CrimeTargeting an opponent, anything that opponent controls, and/or any cards in an opponent’s graveyard is a crime. See rule 700.13.

cumulative upkeep\ra keyword ability tha.term: Cumulative UpkeepA keyword ability that imposes an increasing cost to keep a permanent on the battlefield. See rule 702.24, “Cumulative Upkeep.”

cycling\ra keyword ability that lets a c.term: CyclingA keyword ability that lets a card be discarded and replaced with a new card. See rule 702.29, “Cycling.”

damage\robjects can deal “damage” to cre.term: DamageObjects can deal “damage” to creatures, planeswalkers, and players. This is generally detrimental to the object or player that receives that damage. See rule 120, “Damage.”

damage assignment order (obsolete)\rprev.term: Damage Assignment Order (Obsolete)Previously, if a creature blocks or becomes blocked by multiple creatures, the creature’s controller would be required to choose an order in which it would assign combat damage to the creatures blocking or blocked by it. Now, its controller no longer needs to assign an order, and simply divides its combat damage as they choose among all creatures it’s blocking or blocked by. See rules 510.1c-d.

dash\ra keyword ability found on creatur.term: DashA keyword ability found on creature cards that allows them to be cast for an alternative cost. See rule 702.109, “Dash.”

day\ralong with night, a designation the.term: DayAlong with night, a designation the game can have. See rule 730, “Day and Night,” and rule 702.145, “Daybound and Nightbound.”

daybound\ran ability found on the front.term: DayboundAn ability found on the front faces of some double-faced cards. Cards with daybound and nightbound are face up when it’s day and face down when it’s night. See rule 702.145, “Daybound and Nightbound,” and rule 730, “Day and Night.”

deathtouch\ra keyword ability that cause.term: DeathtouchA keyword ability that causes damage dealt by an object to be especially effective. See rule 702.2, “Deathtouch.”

decayed\ra keyword ability that means “t.term: DecayedA keyword ability that means “This creature can’t block” and “When this creature attacks, sacrifice it at end of combat. See rule 702.147, “Decayed.”

deck\rthe collection of cards a player s.term: DeckThe collection of cards a player starts the game with; it becomes that player’s library. See rule 100, “General,” and rule 103, “Starting the Game.”

declare attackers\rto choose a set of cr.term: Declare AttackersTo choose a set of creatures that will attack, declare whether each creature is attacking the defending player or a planeswalker that player controls, and pay any costs required to allow those creatures to attack. See rule 508.1.

declare attackers step\rpart of the turn.term: Declare Attackers StepPart of the turn. This step is the second step of the combat phase. See rule 508, “Declare Attackers Step.”

declare blockers\rto choose a set of cre.term: Declare BlockersTo choose a set of creatures that will block, declare which attacking creature each creature is blocking, and pay any costs required to allow those creatures to block. See rule 509.1.

declare blockers step\rpart of the turn..term: Declare Blockers StepPart of the turn. This step is the third step of the combat phase. See rule 509, “Declare Blockers Step.”

defender\ra keyword ability that prohibi.term: DefenderA keyword ability that prohibits a creature from attacking. See rule 702.3, “Defender.”

defending player\rthe player who can be.term: Defending PlayerThe player who can be attacked, and whose planeswalkers can be attacked, during the combat phase. See rule 506.2. In certain multiplayer games, there may be more than one defending player; see rule 802, “Attack Multiple Players Option,” and rule 805.10.

defending team\rthe team who can be atta.term: Defending TeamThe team who can be attacked, and whose planeswalkers can be attacked, during the combat phase of a multiplayer game using the shared team turns option. See rule 805, “Shared Team Turns Option.”

defense\r1. part of a card that only bat.term: Defense1. Part of a card that only battle cards have. A battle card’s defense is printed in its lower right corner. See rule 210, “Defense.”2. A characteristic that only battles can have. See rule 310, “Battles.”

delayed triggered ability\ran ability cr.term: Delayed Triggered AbilityAn ability created by effects generated when some spells or abilities resolve, or when some replacement effects are applied, that does something later on rather than at that time. See rule 603.7.

delve\ra keyword ability that lets you e.term: DelveA keyword ability that lets you exile cards from your graveyard rather than pay generic mana to cast a spell. See rule 702.66, “Delve.”

demonstrate\ra triggered ability found o.term: DemonstrateA triggered ability found on some spells that let its controller copy it and choose an opponent to also copy it. See rule 702.144, “Demonstrate.”

dependency\ra system that may be used to.term: DependencyA system that may be used to determine in which order continuous effects in the same layer or sublayer are applied. See rule 613.8. See also Timestamp Order.

deploy creatures option\ran option that.term: Deploy Creatures OptionAn option that may be used in certain multiplayer variants to pass control of creatures between teammates. See rule 804, “Deploy Creatures Option.”

destroy\rto move a permanent from the ba.term: DestroyTo move a permanent from the battlefield to its owner’s graveyard. See rule 701.8, “Destroy.”

detain\ra keyword action that temporaril.term: DetainA keyword action that temporarily stops a permanent from attacking, blocking, or having its activated abilities activated. See rule 701.35, “Detain.”

dethrone\ra keyword ability that puts a.term: DethroneA keyword ability that puts a +1/+1 counter on a creature when it attacks the player with the most life. See rule 702.105, “Dethrone.”

devoid\ra characteristic-defining abilit.term: DevoidA characteristic-defining ability that makes an object colorless. See rule 702.114, “Devoid.”

devotion\ra numerical value a player has.term: DevotionA numerical value a player has, equal to the number of mana symbols of a certain color among the mana costs of permanents that player controls. See rule 700.5.

devour\ra keyword ability that can have.term: DevourA keyword ability that can have a creature enter the battlefield with +1/+1 counters on it. See rule 702.82, “Devour.”

dies\ra creature or planeswalker “dies”.term: DiesA creature or planeswalker “dies” if it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield. See rule 700.4.

discard\rto move a card from its owner’s.term: DiscardTo move a card from its owner’s hand to that player’s graveyard. See rule 701.9, “Discard.”

discover\ra keyword ability that may all.term: DiscoverA keyword ability that may allow a player to cast a random spell for free. See rule 701.57, “Discover.”

disguise\ra keyword ability that lets a.term: DisguiseA keyword ability that lets a card be cast face down as a 2/2 creature with ward {2}. See rule 702.168, “Disguise,” and rule 708, “Face-Down Spells and Permanents.”

disturb\ra keyword ability that allows a.term: DisturbA keyword ability that allows a player to cast a double-faced card transformed from the graveyard. See rule 702.146, “Disturb.”

doctor’s companion\ra partner ability th.term: Doctor’s CompanionA partner ability that allows a player to play with two legendary creature cards as their commander if one of them has Doctor’s companion and the other is a Time Lord Doctor with no other creature types.

door\ra door is one half of a room perma.term: DoorA door is one half of a Room permanent. See rule 709, “Split Cards.”

double\ra keyword action used in a varie.term: DoubleA keyword action used in a variety of contexts. See rule 701.10, “Double.”

double agenda\ra variant of the hidden a.term: Double AgendaA variant of the hidden agenda ability. See rule 702.106, “Hidden Agenda.”

double strike\ra keyword ability that le.term: Double StrikeA keyword ability that lets a creature deal its combat damage twice. See rule 702.4, “Double Strike.”

double-faced cards\rcards with two faces.term: Double-Faced CardsCards with two faces, one on each side of the card, and no Magic card back. See rule 712, “Double-Faced Cards.”

draft\r1. a limited format in which play.term: Draft1. A Limited format in which players choose cards one at a time from booster packs, then construct a deck solely from the chosen cards and basic land cards.2. To choose a card during a draft and put it into your card pool.

draft round\rpart of a draft in which ea.term: Draft RoundPart of a draft in which each player opens an unopened booster pack and the cards in those booster packs are drafted. See rules 905.1a and 905.1b.

draw\r1. to put the top card of a player.term: Draw1. To put the top card of a player’s library into their hand as a turn-based action or as the result of an effect that uses the word “draw.” See rule 121, “Drawing a Card.”2. The result of a game in which neither player wins or loses. See rule 104.4.

draw step\rpart of the turn. this step i.term: Draw StepPart of the turn. This step is the third and final step of the beginning phase. See rule 504, “Draw Step.”

dredge\ra keyword ability that lets a pl.term: DredgeA keyword ability that lets a player return a card from their graveyard to their hand. See rule 702.52, “Dredge.”

dungeon\ra card type found on nontraditi.term: DungeonA card type found on nontraditional Magic cards. A dungeon card is not a permanent. See rule 309, “Dungeons.”

during (obsolete)\rsome older cards used.term: During (Obsolete)Some older cards used the phrase “during [phase], [action].” These abilities were called “phase abilities.” In general, cards that were printed with phase abilities have received errata in the Oracle card reference so they have abilities that trigger at the beginning of a step or phase. “During” still appears in current card text, but only in its normal English sense and not as game terminology.

echo\ra keyword ability that imposes a c.term: EchoA keyword ability that imposes a cost to keep a permanent on the battlefield. See rule 702.30, “Echo.”

edh (obsolete)\ran older name for the co.term: EDH (Obsolete)An older name for the Commander casual variant. See rule 903, “Commander.”

effect\rsomething that happens in the ga.term: EffectSomething that happens in the game as a result of a spell or ability. See rule 609, “Effects.”

embalm\ra keyword ability that lets a pl.term: EmbalmA keyword ability that lets a player exile a creature card from their graveyard to create a mummified token version of that card. See rule 702.128, “Embalm.”

emblem\ran emblem is a marker used to re.term: EmblemAn emblem is a marker used to represent an object that has one or more abilities, but no other characteristics. See rule 114, “Emblems.”

emerge\ra keyword ability that lets a pl.term: EmergeA keyword ability that lets a player cast a spell for less by sacrificing a creature. See rule 702.119, “Emerge.”

emperor\rthe middle player on each team.term: EmperorThe middle player on each team in an Emperor game. See rule 809, “Emperor Variant.”

emperor variant\ra multiplayer variant p.term: Emperor VariantA multiplayer variant played among three-player teams. See rule 809, “Emperor Variant.”

enchant\ra keyword ability that defines.term: EnchantA keyword ability that defines what an Aura spell can target and what an Aura permanent can be attached to. See rule 303, “Enchantments,” and rule 702.5, “Enchant.”

enchantment\ra card type. an enchantment.term: EnchantmentA card type. An enchantment is a permanent. See rule 303, “Enchantments.” See also Aura.

enchantment type\ra subtype that’s corre.term: Enchantment TypeA subtype that’s correlated to the enchantment card type. See rule 303, “Enchantments.” See rule 205.3h for the list of enchantment types.

encoded\ra term that describes the relat.term: EncodedA term that describes the relationship between a permanent and a card exiled by a cipher ability. See rule 702.99, “Cipher.”

encore\ra keyword ability that lets a pl.term: EncoreA keyword ability that lets a player exile a creature card from their graveyard to, for each opponent, create a token that’s a copy of that card to attack that opponent. See rule 702.141, “Encore”

encounter\rto move a phenomenon card off.term: EncounterTo move a phenomenon card off the top of a planar deck and turn it face up. See rule 312, “Phenomena.”

end of combat step\rpart of the turn. th.term: End of Combat StepPart of the turn. This step is the fifth and final step of the combat phase. See rule 511, “End of Combat Step.”

end step\rpart of the turn. this step is.term: End StepPart of the turn. This step is the first step of the ending phase. See rule 513, “End Step.”

end the combat phase\rto “end the combat.term: End the Combat PhaseTo “end the combat phase” as the result of an effect is to perform an expedited process that skips everything else that would happen that phase. See rule 723, “Ending Turns and Phases.”

end the turn\rto “end the turn” as the r.term: End the TurnTo “end the turn” as the result of an effect is to perform an expedited process that skips nearly everything else that would happen that turn. See rule 723, “Ending Turns and Phases.”

ending phase\rpart of the turn. this pha.term: Ending PhasePart of the turn. This phase is the fifth and final phase of the turn. See rule 512, “Ending Phase.”

endure\ra keyword ability that lets you.term: EndureA keyword ability that lets you choose put +1/+1 counters on a creature or create a Spirit creature token. See rule 702.62, “Endure.”

energy symbol\rthe energy symbol {e} rep.term: Energy SymbolThe energy symbol {E} represents one energy counter. To pay {E}, a player removes one energy counter from themselves.

enlist\ra keyword ability that allows a.term: EnlistA keyword ability that allows a creature that could have attacked to support another creature. See rule 702.154, “Enlist.”

enter\rin rules text, to enter the battl.term: EnterIn rules text, to enter the battlefield. See “Enters the Battlefield.”

enters the battlefield\ra nontoken perma.term: Enters the BattlefieldA nontoken permanent enters the battlefield when it’s moved onto the battlefield from another zone. A token enters the battlefield as it’s created. See rules 403.3, 603.6a, 603.6d, and 614.12. This phrase has been shortened to simply “enters” in rules text on cards in most contexts.

entwine\ra keyword ability that lets a p.term: EntwineA keyword ability that lets a player choose all modes for a spell rather than just the number specified. See rule 702.42, “Entwine.”

epic\ra keyword ability that lets a play.term: EpicA keyword ability that lets a player copy a spell at the beginning of each of their upkeeps at the expense of casting any other spells for the rest of the game. See rule 702.50, “Epic.”

equip\ra keyword ability that lets a pla.term: EquipA keyword ability that lets a player attach an Equipment to a creature they control. See rule 301, “Artifacts,” and rule 702.6, “Equip.”

equipment\ran artifact subtype. equipmen.term: EquipmentAn artifact subtype. Equipment can be attached to creatures. See rule 301, “Artifacts,” and rule 702.6, “Equip.”

escalate\ra keyword ability on some moda.term: EscalateA keyword ability on some modal spells that adds a cost for choosing additional modes. See rule 702.120, “Escalate.”

escape\ra keyword ability that lets a pl.term: EscapeA keyword ability that lets a player cast a card from their graveyard. See rule 702.138, “Escape.”

eternalize\ra keyword ability that lets.term: EternalizeA keyword ability that lets a player exile a creature card from their graveyard to create an eternalized token version of that card. See rule 702.129, “Eternalize.”

evasion ability\ran ability that restric.term: Evasion AbilityAn ability that restricts what creatures can block an attacking creature. See rules 509.1b–c.

event\ranything that happens in a game..term: EventAnything that happens in a game. See rule 700.1.

evoke\ra keyword ability that causes a p.term: EvokeA keyword ability that causes a permanent to be sacrificed when it enters the battlefield. See rule 702.74, “Evoke.”

evolve\ra keyword ability that lets you.term: EvolveA keyword ability that lets you put a +1/+1 counter on a creature when a larger creature enters the battlefield under your control. See rule 702.100, “Evolve.”

exalted\ra keyword ability that can make.term: ExaltedA keyword ability that can make a creature better in combat. See rule 702.83, “Exalted.”

exchange\rto swap two things, such as ob.term: ExchangeTo swap two things, such as objects, sets of objects, or life totals. See rule 701.12, “Exchange.”

exert\ra keyword action that stops a per.term: ExertA keyword action that stops a permanent from untapping during the next untap step of the player who exerted it. See rule 701.43, “Exert.”

excess damage\rdamage dealt to a creatur.term: Excess DamageDamage dealt to a creature greater than what would be lethal damage or damage dealt to a planeswalker greater than its loyalty. See rule 120.4a.

exile\r1. a zone. exile is essentially a.term: Exile1. A zone. Exile is essentially a holding area for cards. It used to be known as the “removed-from-the-game” zone.2. To put an object into the exile zone from whatever zone it’s currently in. An “exiled” card is one that’s been put into the exile zone.See rule 406, “Exile.”

exhaust\ra special kind of activated abi.term: ExhaustA special kind of activated ability that may be activated only once. See rule 702.177, “Exhaust.”

expansion symbol\ra card’s expansion sym.term: Expansion SymbolA card’s expansion symbol is a small icon normally printed below the right edge of the illustration that has no effect on game play. See rule 206, “Expansion Symbol.”

expend\ra word found on some abilities t.term: ExpendA word found on some abilities that care how much mana a player has spent to cast spells this turn. See rule 700.14.

exploit\ra keyword ability that lets you.term: ExploitA keyword ability that lets you sacrifice a creature for a benefit. See rule 702.110, “Exploit.”

explore\ra keyword action that causes a.term: ExploreA keyword action that causes a player to reveal the top card of their library and then to take different actions depending on whether a land card is revealed this way. See rule 701.44, “Explore.”

extort\ra keyword ability that lets you.term: ExtortA keyword ability that lets you gain life and have opponents lose life whenever you cast a spell. See rule 702.101, “Extort.”

extra turn\ra turn created by an effect.term: Extra TurnA turn created by an effect of a spell or ability. See rule 500.7. For rules about extra turns in a multiplayer game using the shared team turns option, see 805.8. For rules about extra turns in a Grand Melee game, see rule 807.4.

fabricate\ra keyword ability that lets y.term: FabricateA keyword ability that lets you choose whether to create Servo tokens or put +1/+1 counters on a creature. See rule 702.123, “Fabricate.”

face a villainous choice\ra keyword acti.term: Face a Villainous ChoiceA keyword action that causes a player to choose one of two listed choices. See rule 701.55, “Face a Villainous Choice.”

face down\r1. a card is “face down” if i.term: Face Down1. A card is “face down” if it’s physically positioned so the card back is showing. Cards in some zones are normally kept face down. See section 4, “Zones.”2. A status a permanent may have. See rule 110.5 and rule 702.37, “Morph.”3. Face-down spells have additional rules. See rule 708, “Face-Down Spells and Permanents,” and rule 702.37, “Morph.”

face up\r1. a card is “face up” if it’s.term: Face Up1. A card is “face up” if it’s physically positioned so the card front is showing. Cards in some zones are normally kept face up. See section 4, “Zones.”2. A default status a permanent may have. See rule 110.5 and rule 702.37, “Morph.”

fading\ra keyword ability that limits ho.term: FadingA keyword ability that limits how long a permanent remains on the battlefield. See rule 702.32, “Fading.”

fateseal\rto manipulate some of the card.term: FatesealTo manipulate some of the cards on top of an opponent’s library. See rule 701.29, “Fateseal.”

fear\ra keyword ability that restricts h.term: FearA keyword ability that restricts how a creature may be blocked. See rule 702.36, “Fear.”

fight\rwhen two creatures fight, each de.term: FightWhen two creatures fight, each deals damage equal to its power to the other. See rule 701.14, “Fight.”

finality counter\ra counter that exiles.term: Finality CounterA counter that exiles the permanent it is on if that permanent would go to the graveyard from the battlefield. See rule 122.1h.

first strike\ra keyword ability that let.term: First StrikeA keyword ability that lets a creature deal its combat damage before other creatures. See rule 702.7, “First Strike.”

flanking\ra keyword ability that can mak.term: FlankingA keyword ability that can make a creature better in combat. See rule 702.25, “Flanking.”

flash\ra keyword ability that lets a pla.term: FlashA keyword ability that lets a player play a card any time they could cast an instant. See rule 702.8, “Flash.”

flashback\ra keyword ability that lets a.term: FlashbackA keyword ability that lets a player cast a card from their graveyard. See rule 702.34, “Flashback.”

flavor text\rtext in italics (but not in.term: Flavor TextText in italics (but not in parentheses) in the text box of a card that has no effect on play. See rule 207.2.

flavor word\ran italicized word with no.term: Flavor WordAn italicized word with no rules meaning that provides a flavorful description of an ability. See rule 207.2d.

flip cards\rcards with a two-part card f.term: Flip CardsCards with a two-part card frame (one part of which is printed upside down) on a single card. See rule 710, “Flip Cards.”

flipped\ra status a permanent may have..term: FlippedA status a permanent may have. See rule 110.5 and rule 710, “Flip Cards.” See also Unflipped.

flipping a coin\ra method of randomizati.term: Flipping a CoinA method of randomization with two possible outcomes of equal likelihood. See rule 705, “Flipping a Coin.”

flying\ra keyword ability that restricts.term: FlyingA keyword ability that restricts how a creature may be blocked. See rule 702.9, “Flying.”

food token\ra food token is a colorless.term: Food TokenA Food token is a colorless artifact token with “{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this token: You gain 3 life.” For more information about predefined tokens, see rule 111.10.

for mirrodin!\ra keyword ability that cr.term: For Mirrodin!A keyword ability that creates a 2/2 red Rebel creature token and then attaches the Equipment with the ability to that token. See rule 702.163, “For Mirrodin!”

forage\rto pay a cost of exiling three c.term: ForageTo pay a cost of exiling three cards from your graveyard or sacrificing a Food. See rule 701.61, “Forage.”

forecast\ra keyword ability that allows.term: ForecastA keyword ability that allows an activated ability to be activated from a player’s hand. See rule 702.57, “Forecast.”

forest\rone of the five basic land types.term: ForestOne of the five basic land types. Any land with this subtype has the ability “{T}: Add {G}.” See rule 305.6.

foretell\ra keyword ability that lets a.term: ForetellA keyword ability that lets a player exile cards from their hand and cast them for an alternative cost on future turns. See rule 702.143, “Foretell.”

foretold\ra card exiled using the forete.term: ForetoldA card exiled using the foretell special action becomes foretold. Other effects can also make an exiled card foretold. A spell was foretold if it was a foretold card in exile before it was cast.

fortification\ran artifact subtype. fort.term: FortificationAn artifact subtype. Fortifications can be attached to lands. See rule 301, “Artifacts,” and rule 702.67, “Fortify.”

fortify\ra keyword ability that lets a p.term: FortifyA keyword ability that lets a player attach a Fortification to a land they control. See rule 301, “Artifacts,” and rule 702.67, “Fortify.”

frenzy\ra keyword ability that can make.term: FrenzyA keyword ability that can make a creature better in combat. See rule 702.68, “Frenzy.”

free-for-all\ra multiplayer variant in w.term: Free-for-AllA multiplayer variant in which a group of players compete as individuals against each other. See rule 806, “Free-for-All Variant.”

freerunning\ra keyword ability that allo.term: FreerunningA keyword ability that allows certain spells to be cast for an alternative cost. See rule 702.173, “Freerunning.”

friends forever\ra variant of the partne.term: Friends ForeverA variant of the partner ability that lets two legendary creature cardss be your commander in the Commander variant rather than one if both have the “friends forever” ability. See rule 702.124, “Partner,” and rule 903, “Commander.”

full party\ra player has a full party if.term: Full PartyA player has a full party if the number of creatures in their party is four. See rule 700.8.

fuse\ra keyword ability that allows a pl.term: FuseA keyword ability that allows a player to cast both halves of a split card. See rule 702.102, “Fuse.”

fused split spell\ra split card on the s.term: Fused Split SpellA split card on the stack that has been cast using the fuse ability or a copy of such a card. See rule 702.102, “Fuse.”

general\rany player in the emperor multi.term: GeneralAny player in the Emperor multiplayer variant who isn’t an emperor. See rule 809, “Emperor Variant.”

generic mana\rmana in a cost represented.term: Generic ManaMana in a cost represented by numerical symbols (such as {1}) or variable symbols (such as {X}) that can be paid with mana of any type. See rule 107.4.

gift\ra keyword ability that allows a sp.term: GiftA keyword ability that allows a spell’s caster to choose an opponent as to receive a benefit as the spell resolves or when the permanent with the ability enters. See rule 702.174, “Gift.”

global enchantment (obsolete)\ran obsole.term: Global Enchantment (Obsolete)An obsolete term for a non-Aura enchantment. Cards printed with this text have received errata in the Oracle card reference.

goad\ra keyword action that causes a cre.term: GoadA keyword action that causes a creature to be goaded until a player’s next turn. See rule 701.15, “Goad.”

goaded\ra designation a permanent can ha.term: GoadedA designation a permanent can have. Goaded creatures are forced to attack and to attack a player other than the player that caused it to be goaded. See rule 701.15, “Goad.”

gold token\ra gold token is a colorless.term: Gold TokenA Gold token is a colorless artifact token with “Sacrifice this token: Add one mana of any color.” For more information on predefined tokens, see rule 111.10.

graft\ra keyword ability that has a perm.term: GraftA keyword ability that has a permanent enter the battlefield with +1/+1 counters on it and can move those counters to other creatures. See rule 702.58, “Graft.”

grand melee\ra multiplayer variant in wh.term: Grand MeleeA multiplayer variant in which a large group of players (usually ten or more) compete as individuals against each other. See rule 807, “Grand Melee Variant.”

gravestorm\ra keyword ability that creat.term: GravestormA keyword ability that creates copies of a spell. See rule 702.69, “Gravestorm.”

graveyard\r1. a zone. a player’s graveya.term: Graveyard1. A zone. A player’s graveyard is their discard pile.2. All the cards in a player’s graveyard.See rule 404, “Graveyard.”

hand\r1. a zone. a player’s hand is wher.term: Hand1. A zone. A player’s hand is where that player holds cards they have drawn but not played yet.2. All the cards in a player’s hand.See rule 402, “Hand.”

hand modifier\ra characteristic that onl.term: Hand ModifierA characteristic that only vanguards have. See rule 211, “Hand Modifier.”

harmonize\ra keyword ability that lets a.term: HarmonizeA keyword ability that lets a player cast a card from their graveyard for a specific cost and lets them tap a creature they control to reduce that cost. See rule 702.180, “Harmonize.”

haste\ra keyword ability that lets a cre.term: HasteA keyword ability that lets a creature ignore the “summoning sickness” rule. See rule 702.10, “Haste,” and rule 302.6.

haunt\ra keyword ability that exiles car.term: HauntA keyword ability that exiles cards. A card exiled this way “haunts” a creature targeted by the haunt ability. See rule 702.55, “Haunt.”

hexproof\ra keyword ability that preclud.term: HexproofA keyword ability that precludes a permanent or player from being targeted by an opponent. See rule 702.11, “Hexproof.”

hidden agenda\ra keyword ability that al.term: Hidden AgendaA keyword ability that allows a conspiracy card to be put into the command zone face down. See rule 702.106, “Hidden Agenda.”

hidden zone\ra zone in which not all pla.term: Hidden ZoneA zone in which not all players can be expected to see the cards’ faces. See rule 400.2. See also Public Zone.

hideaway\ra keyword ability that lets a.term: HideawayA keyword ability that lets a player store a secret card. See rule 702.75, “Hideaway.”

historic\ran object is historic if it ha.term: HistoricAn object is historic if it has the legendary supertype, the artifact card type, or the Saga subtype. See rule 700.6.

horsemanship\ra keyword ability that res.term: HorsemanshipA keyword ability that restricts how a creature may be blocked. See rule 702.31, “Horsemanship.”

hybrid card\ra card with one or more hyb.term: Hybrid CardA card with one or more hybrid mana symbols in its mana cost. See rule 202.2f.

hybrid mana symbols\ra mana symbol that.term: Hybrid Mana SymbolsA mana symbol that represents a cost that can be paid in one of two ways. See rule 107.4.

hybrid phyrexian mana symbols\ra mana sy.term: Hybrid Phyrexian Mana SymbolsA mana symbol that represents a cost that can be paid in one of three ways. See rule 107.4.

job select\ra keyword ability that creat.term: Job SelectA keyword ability that creates a 1/1 colorless Hero creature token and then attaches the Equipment with the ability to that token. See rule 702.182, “Job Select.”

junk token\ra junk token is a colorless.term: Junk TokenA Junk token is a colorless artifact token with {T}, Sacrifice this token: Exile the top card of your library. You may play that card this turn. Activate only as a sorcery.” For more information about predefined tokens, see rule 111.10.

illegal action\ran action that violates.term: Illegal ActionAn action that violates the rules of the game and/or requirements or restrictions created by effects. See rule 732, “Handling Illegal Actions.”

illegal target\ra target that no longer.term: Illegal TargetA target that no longer exists or no longer meets the specifications stated by the spell or ability that’s targeting it. See rule 608.2b.

illustration\ra picture printed on the u.term: IllustrationA picture printed on the upper half of a card that has no effect on game play. See rule 203, “Illustration.”

illustration credit\rinformation printed.term: Illustration CreditInformation printed directly below the text box that has no effect on game play. See rule 213, “Information Below the Text Box.”

impending\ran ability on some creatures.term: ImpendingAn ability on some creatures that allows them to be cast for an alternative cost. If cast for its impending cost, it isn’t a creature for some period of time. See rule 702.176, “Impending.”

imprint\r“imprint” used to be a keyword.term: Imprint“Imprint” used to be a keyword ability. It is now an ability word and has no rules meaning. All cards printed with the imprint keyword have received errata in the Oracle card reference.

improvise\ra keyword ability that lets y.term: ImproviseA keyword ability that lets you tap artifacts rather than pay mana to cast a spell. See rule 702.126, “Improvise.”

in play (obsolete)\ran obsolete term for.term: In Play (Obsolete)An obsolete term for the battlefield. Cards that were printed with text that contain the phrases “in play,” “from play,” “into play,” or the like are referring to the battlefield and have received errata in the Oracle card reference. See Battlefield.

in response to\ran instant spell that’s.term: In Response ToAn instant spell that’s been cast, or an activated ability that’s been activated, while another spell or ability is on the stack has been cast or activated “in response to” the earlier spell or ability. See rule 117.7.

incubate\ra keyword action that creates.term: IncubateA keyword action that creates an Incubator token with a specified number of +1/+1 counters on it. See rule 701.53, “Incubate.”

incubator token\ran incubator token is a.term: Incubator TokenAn Incubator token is a transforming double-faced token. Its front face is a colorless Incubator artifact with “{2}: Transform this token.” Its back face is a 0/0 colorless Phyrexian artifact creature named “Phyrexian Token.” For more information about predefined tokens, see rule 111.10.

indestructible\ra keyword ability that p.term: IndestructibleA keyword ability that precludes a permanent from being destroyed. See rule 702.12.

infect\ra keyword ability that affects h.term: InfectA keyword ability that affects how an object deals damage to creatures and players. See rule 702.90, “Infect.”

ingest\ra keyword ability that can exile.term: IngestA keyword ability that can exile the top card of a player’s library. See rule 702.115, “Ingest.”

initiative\ra designation a player can h.term: InitiativeA designation a player can have. Some effects instruct a player to take the initiative. The player with the initiative ventures into Undercity whenever they take the initiative and at the beginning of their upkeep. See rule 725, “The Initiative.”

instant\ra card type. an instant is not.term: InstantA card type. An instant is not a permanent. See rule 304, “Instants.”

instead\reffects that use the word “inst.term: InsteadEffects that use the word “instead” are replacement effects. The word “instead” indicates what an event will be replaced with. See rule 614, “Replacement Effects.”

interrupt (obsolete)\ran obsolete card t.term: Interrupt (Obsolete)An obsolete card type. All cards printed with this card type are now instants. All abilities that, as printed, said a player could “play as an interrupt” can now be activated like any other activated abilities (unless they’re mana abilities, in which case they follow those rules instead). All relevant cards have been given errata in the Oracle card reference.

intervening “if” clause\ra specially wor.term: Intervening “If” ClauseA specially worded condition checked as a triggered ability would trigger and again as it would resolve. See rule 603.4.

intimidate\ra keyword ability that restr.term: IntimidateA keyword ability that restricts how a creature may be blocked. See rule 702.13, “Intimidate.”

investigate\ra keyword action that creat.term: InvestigateA keyword action that creates a Clue artifact token. See rule 701.16, “Investigate.”

island\rone of the five basic land types.term: IslandOne of the five basic land types. Any land with this subtype has the ability “{T}: Add {U}.” See rule 305.6.

islandhome (obsolete)\ran obsolete keywo.term: Islandhome (Obsolete)An obsolete keyword ability that meant “This creature can’t attack unless defending player controls an Island” and “When you control no Islands, sacrifice this creature.” Cards printed with this ability have been given errata in the Oracle card reference.

jump-start\ra keyword ability that lets.term: Jump-StartA keyword ability that lets a player cast a card from their graveyard by discarding a card. See rule 702.133, “Jump-Start.”

keyword ability\ra game term, such as “f.term: Keyword AbilityA game term, such as “flying” or “haste,” used as shorthand for a longer ability or group of abilities. See rule 702, “Keyword Abilities.”

keyword action\ra verb, such as “destroy.term: Keyword ActionA verb, such as “destroy” or “cast,” used as a game term rather than as its normal English meaning. See rule 701, “Keyword Actions.”

keyword counter\ra marker placed on an o.term: Keyword CounterA marker placed on an object that modifies its characteristics by granting it a keyword. See rule 122, “Counters.”

kicker, kicked\rkicker is a keyword abil.term: Kicker, KickedKicker is a keyword ability that represents an optional additional cost. A spell has been kicked if its controller declared the intention to pay any or all of its kicker costs. See rule 702.33, “Kicker.”

kindred\ra card type. whether or not a k.term: KindredA card type. Whether or not a kindred is a permanent depends on its other card type. See rule 308, “Kindreds.”

land\ra card type. a land is a permanent.term: LandA card type. A land is a permanent. See rule 305, “Lands.”

land type\ra subtype that’s correlated t.term: Land TypeA subtype that’s correlated to the land card type. See rule 305, “Lands.” See rule 205.3i for the list of land types.

lander token\ra lander token is a colorl.term: Lander TokenA Lander token is a colorless artifact token with “{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this token: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.” For more information about predefined tokens, see rule 111.10.

landwalk\ra generic term for a group of.term: LandwalkA generic term for a group of keyword abilities that restrict whether a creature may be blocked. See rule 702.14, “Landwalk.”

last known information\rinformation abou.term: Last Known InformationInformation about an object that’s no longer in the zone it’s expected to be in, or information about a player who’s no longer in the game. This information captures that object’s last existence in that zone or that player’s last existence in the game. See rules 113.7a, 608.2b, 608.2h, and 800.4h.

layer\ra system used to determine in whi.term: LayerA system used to determine in which order continuous effects are applied. See rule 613, “Interaction of Continuous Effects.” See also Dependency, Timestamp Order.

learn\ra keyword action that lets a play.term: LearnA keyword action that lets a player add a Lesson card to their hand from outside the game or discard a card to draw a card. See rule 701.48, “Learn.”

leaves the battlefield\ra permanent “lea.term: Leaves the BattlefieldA permanent “leaves the battlefield” when it’s moved from the battlefield to another zone, or (if it’s phased in) when it leaves the game because its owner leaves the game. See rules 603.6c and 603.10.

legal text\rinformation printed directly.term: Legal TextInformation printed directly below the text box that has no effect on game play. See rule 213, “Information Below the Text Box.”

legend (obsolete)\ran obsolete creature.term: Legend (Obsolete)An obsolete creature type. Cards printed with this subtype have been given errata in the Oracle card reference so they have the legendary supertype instead. See Legendary.

legendary\ra supertype that’s normally r.term: LegendaryA supertype that’s normally relevant on permanents. See rule 205.4, “Supertypes.” See also Legend Rule.

legend rule\ra state-based action that c.term: Legend RuleA state-based action that causes a player who controls two or more legendary permanents with the same name to put all but one into their owners’ graveyards. See rule 704.5j.

lethal damage\ran amount of damage great.term: Lethal DamageAn amount of damage greater than or equal to a creature’s toughness. See rules 120.4a, 120.6, 510.1, and 704.5g.

level\ra numerical designation a permane.term: LevelA numerical designation a permanent may have. A Class enchantment’s level determines what other abilities it has. See rule 716, “Class Cards.”

level symbol\ra symbol that represents a.term: Level SymbolA symbol that represents a keyword ability indicating abilities, power, and toughness a leveler card may have. See rule 107.8 and rule 711, “Leveler Cards.”

level up\ra keyword ability that can put.term: Level UpA keyword ability that can put level counters on a creature. See rule 702.87, “Level Up.” For class level abilities of Class cards, see rule 716, “Class Cards.”

leveler cards\rcards with striated text.term: Leveler CardsCards with striated text boxes and three power/toughness boxes. See rule 711, “Leveler Cards.”

library\r1. a zone. a player’s library i.term: Library1. A zone. A player’s library is where that player draws cards from.2. All the cards in a player’s library.See rule 401, “Library.”

life, life total\reach player has an amo.term: Life, Life TotalEach player has an amount of “life,” represented by that player’s “life total.” Life may be gained or lost. See rule 119, “Life.”

life modifier\ra characteristic that onl.term: Life ModifierA characteristic that only vanguards have. See rule 212, “Life Modifier.”

lifelink\ra keyword ability that causes.term: LifelinkA keyword ability that causes a player to gain life. See rule 702.15, “Lifelink.”

limited\ra way of playing in which each.term: LimitedA way of playing in which each player gets a quantity of unopened Magic product and creates their own deck on the spot. See rule 100.2.

limited range of influence\ran optional.term: Limited Range of InfluenceAn optional rule used in some multiplayer games that limits what a player can affect. See rule 801, “Limited Range of Influence Option.”

linked abilities\rtwo abilities printed.term: Linked AbilitiesTwo abilities printed on the same object such that one of them causes actions to be taken or objects to be affected and the other one directly refers to those actions or objects. See rule 607, “Linked Abilities.”

living metal\ra keyword ability found on.term: Living MetalA keyword ability found on some Vehicles that turns them into a creature during your turn. See rule 702.161, “Living Metal.”

living weapon\ra keyword ability that cr.term: Living WeaponA keyword ability that creates a 0/0 black Phyrexian Germ creature token and then attaches the Equipment with the ability to that token. See rule 702.92, “Living Weapon.”

local enchantment (obsolete)\ran obsolet.term: Local Enchantment (Obsolete)An obsolete term for an Aura. Cards printed with this text have received errata in the Oracle card reference.

lock\rto remove an unlocked designation.term: LockTo remove an unlocked designation from a permanent that has one or more unlocked halves. See rule 709.5g.

locked\rone half of a split permanent is.term: LockedOne half of a split permanent is “locked” if it doesn’t have the appropriate unlocked designation. See rule 709.5.

london mulligan\rinformal term for the c.term: London MulliganInformal term for the current system of mulligan rules. See rule 103.5.

loop\ra set of actions that could be rep.term: LoopA set of actions that could be repeated indefinitely. See rule 731, “Taking Shortcuts.”

lose the game\rthere are several ways to.term: Lose the GameThere are several ways to lose the game. See rule 104, “Ending the Game,” rule 810.8 (for additional rules for Two-Headed Giant games), rule 809.5 (for additional rules for Emperor games), and rule 903.10 (for an additional rule for Commander games).

loyalty\r1. part of a card that only pla.term: Loyalty1. Part of a card that only planeswalker cards have. A planeswalker card’s loyalty is printed in its lower right corner. See rule 209, “Loyalty.”2. A characteristic that only planeswalkers have. See rule 306.5.

loyalty ability\ran activated ability wi.term: Loyalty AbilityAn activated ability with a loyalty symbol in its cost. See rule 606, “Loyalty Abilities.”

madness\ra keyword ability that lets a p.term: MadnessA keyword ability that lets a player cast a card they discard. See rule 702.35, “Madness.”

main game\rthe game in which a spell (or.term: Main GameThe game in which a spell (or ability) that created a subgame was cast (or activated). See rule 728, “Subgames.”

main phase\rpart of the turn. the first,.term: Main PhasePart of the turn. The first, or precombat, main phase is the second phase of the turn. The second, or postcombat, main phase is the fourth phase of the turn. See rule 505, “Main Phase.”

mana\rthe primary resource in the game..term: ManaThe primary resource in the game. It is spent to pay costs, usually when casting spells and activating abilities. See rule 106, “Mana,” rule 107.4, and rule 202, “Mana Cost and Color.”

mana ability\ran activated or triggered.term: Mana AbilityAn activated or triggered ability that could create mana and doesn’t use the stack. See rule 605, “Mana Abilities.”

mana burn (obsolete)\rolder versions of.term: Mana Burn (Obsolete)Older versions of the rules stated that unspent mana caused a player to lose life; this was called “mana burn.” That rule no longer exists.

mana cost\ra characteristic, and part of.term: Mana CostA characteristic, and part of a card. A card’s mana cost is indicated by the mana symbols printed in its upper right corner. See rule 107.4 and rule 202, “Mana Cost and Color.”

mana pool\rwhere mana created by an effe.term: Mana PoolWhere mana created by an effect is temporarily stored. See rule 106.4.

mana source (obsolete)\ran obsolete card.term: Mana Source (Obsolete)An obsolete card type. All cards printed with this card type are now instants. All abilities that, as printed, said a player could “play as a mana source” are now mana abilities. All relevant cards have been given errata in the Oracle card reference.

mana symbol\ran icon that represents man.term: Mana SymbolAn icon that represents mana or a mana cost. See rule 107.4.

mana value\rthe total amount of mana in.term: Mana ValueThe total amount of mana in a mana cost, regardless of color. See rule 202.3.

manifest\ra keyword action that puts a c.term: ManifestA keyword action that puts a card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. See rule 701.40, “Manifest,” and rule 708, “Face-Down Spells and Permanents.”

manifest dread\ra keyword action that pu.term: Manifest DreadA keyword action that puts one of the top two cards of your library onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. See rule 701.62, “Manifest Dread,” rule 701.40, “Manifest,” and rule 708, “Face-Down Spells and Permanents.”

map\ra map token is a colorless map arti.term: MapA Map token is a colorless Map artifact token with “{1}, {T}, Sacrifice this token: Target creature you control explores. Activate only as a sorcery.” See rule 701.44, “Explore.” For more information about predefined tokens, see rule 110.10.

match\ra multiplayer game or a two-playe.term: MatchA multiplayer game or a two-player series of games (usually best-two-of-three) played in a tournament. See rule 100.6.

max speed\r1. a player has max speed if.term: Max Speed1. A player has max speed if their speed is 4. See rule 702.179, “Start Your Engines!”2. A keyword ability that grants an ability to the permanent or card it’s on only if that permanent’s controller (or that card’s owner, if it isn’t on the battlefield) has a speed of 4. See rule 702.178, “Max Speed.”

maximum hand size\rthe number of cards i.term: Maximum Hand SizeThe number of cards in hand a player must discard down to during their cleanup step. See rule 402.2 and 514.1.

megamorph\ra variant of the morph abilit.term: MegamorphA variant of the morph ability that puts a +1/+1 counter on the creature as it turns face up. See rule 702.37, “Morph.”

meld\rto turn two members of a meld pair.term: MeldTo turn two members of a meld pair so their back faces are up and combined into one oversized Magic card. See rule 701.42, “Meld.”

meld cards\rcards with a magic card face.term: Meld CardsCards with a Magic card face on one side and half of an oversized Magic card face on the other. See rule 712, “Double-Faced Cards.”

melee\ra keyword ability that improves a.term: MeleeA keyword ability that improves an attacking creature based on the number of opponents you attacked. See rule 702.121, “Melee.”

menace\ran evasion ability that makes cr.term: MenaceAn evasion ability that makes creatures unblockable by a single creature. See rule 702.111, “Menace.”

mentor\ra keyword ability that lets your.term: MentorA keyword ability that lets your bigger creatures power up your smaller creatures when they attack together. See rule 702.134, “Mentor.”

merged permanent\ra card or token may me.term: Merged PermanentA card or token may merge with a permanent to form a merged permanent. This merged permanent is represented by more than one card and/or token. See rule 729, “Merging with Permanents.”
